bill.title: Senate Substitute for HB 2228 by Committee on Assessment and Taxation - Increasing and allowing Kansas itemized deductions, increasing Kansas standard deduction, allowing individual expensing deduction, modifying the treatment of foreign corporate income and GILTI income, and providing for certain income tax credits.
bill.description: Senate Substitute for HB 2228 by Committee on Assessment and Taxation - Increasing and allowing Kansas itemized deductions, increasing Kansas standard deduction, allowing individual expensing deduction, modifying the treatment of foreign corporate income and GILTI income, and providing for certain income tax credits.

history.action: House Introduced
House Referred to Committee on Taxation
House Hearing: Monday, February 20, 2017, 03:30 PM Room 346-S
House Committee Report recommending bill be passed as amended by Committee on Taxation
House Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted
House Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
House Engrossed on Tuesday, March 14, 2017
House Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 119 Nay: 0
Senate Received and Introduced
Senate Referred to Committee on Assessment and Taxation
Senate Hearing: Wednesday, May 03, 2017, 09:30 AM Room 548-S
Senate Committee Report recommending substitute bill be passed by Committee on Assessment and Taxation
Senate Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
Senate Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted recommending substitute bill be passed
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Pyle
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Pyle was rejected  Yea: 19 Nay: 20
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Alley
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Alley was rejected
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Hardy
Senate  Senator Baumgardner raised a question of germaneness. The amendment was ruled germane.
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Hardy was adopted
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Pyle
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Pyle was rejected  Yea: 18 Nay: 21
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Petersen
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Petersen was adopted
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Hilderbrand
Senate  Senator V. Schmidt raised a question of germaneness. The amendment was ruled not germane.
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Tyson
Senate  Senator Francisco raised a question of germaneness. The amendment was ruled not germane.
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Alley
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Alley was adopted
Senate Committee of the Whole - Substitute bill be passed as amended
Senate Emergency Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 24 Nay: 16
House Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
House Nonconcurred with amendments; Conference Committee requested; appointed Representative Johnson , Representative Phillips and Representative Sawyer as conferees
Senate Motion to accede adopted;  Senator Tyson,  Senator Kerschen and  Senator Holland appointed as conferees
Senate Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
Senate Conference Committee Report agree to disagree adopted;  Senator Tyson,  Senator Kerschen and  Senator Holland appointed as second conferees
House Conference committee report to agree to disagree adopted; Representative Johnson, Representative Phillips and Representative Sawyer appointed as Second conferees.
Senate Conference committee report now available
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 21 Nay: 19
House Conference Committee Report not adopted;  Yea: 59 Nay: 59
